definitions.text: having or feeling no doubt or uncertainty; confident and assured
examples: was sure (or certain) she had seen it
was very sure in his beliefs

definitions.text: exercising or taking care great enough to bring assurance
examples: be certain to disconnect the iron when you are through
be sure to lock the doors

definitions.text: certain to occur; destined or inevitable; ; ; - Benjamin Franklin
examples: In this life nothing is certain but death and taxes
a sure way to distinguish the two
wood dust is a sure sign of termites

definitions.text: (of persons) worthy of trust or confidence

examples: a sure (or true) sign of one's commitment
a sure hand on the throttle

definitions.text: definitely or positively (`sure' is sometimes used informally for `surely')
examples: she certainly is a hard worker
it's going to be a good day for sure
they thought he had been killed sure enough
